DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study examine whether ingestion herbal dietary supplement Ginkgo biloba extract effect efficacy three class diabetic medication - ( Glucotrol , Glucophage Actose ) . Additionally , study examine effect Ginkgo biloba extract pancreatic insulin production non-diabetic subject age 20 75 year old .
DOC.brief_title: Ginkgo Biloba Extract Insulin Resistance Syndrome
DOC.detailed_description: Herbal remedy popular among chronic disease , may already take several prescription medication , thereby increase risk drug-herb interaction . Ginkgo biloba extract popular dietary supplement ingest general population enhance mental focus elderly delay onset age-acquired loss cognitive function . In subject non-insulin dependent diabetes ( NIDDM ) , ingestion Ginkgo biloba may decrease efficacy hypoglycemic agent increase whole body insulin resistance . Because age significant risk factor development NIDDM result progressive decline pancreatic function , elderly chronically take multiple prescription medication , increase use Ginkgo biloba population may increase drug-herb interaction . Therefore , shall examine effect Ginkgo biloba pancreatic function elderly determine whether may produce pancreatic dysfunction potential development insulinopenia . The result study provide valuable information design new therapeutic strategy treatment diseases insulin resistance syndrome .
DOC.criteria: Clinical diagnosis type 2 diabetes mellitus take oral diabetes medication Glucotrol , Glucophage Actose Avandia Must able swallow Healthy individual without diabetes age 20 80 year age Type 1 diabetes mellitus Type 2 diabetes mellitus take insulin injection Regular use antiinflammatory drug Chronic anemia
